snippet: A militant union refused to sign a peace deal with the platinum company Lonmin on Thursday, undermining government-backed efforts to open pay talks and end a four-week strike scarred by deadly violence.
abstract: Militant union refuses to sign a peace deal with the platinum company Lonmin, undermining South Africa's government-backed efforts to open pay talks and end a four-week strike scarred by deadly violence.
lead_paragraph: A militant union refused to sign a peace deal with the platinum company Lonmin on Thursday, undermining government-backed efforts to open pay talks and end a four-week strike scarred by deadly violence.

headline.main: South Africa: Union Snubs a Deal
